column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: Vimpatter, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Wow after many other combinations this one finally work. Note it was hard to get use to side effects were apparent at each increase, but if you stick it out they do disapear. I have been siezure free (at least grand mal) for 4 months now and started this medication 8 months ago. Now the only side effect I can report is the dizzeness and that only lasts 20 minutes or so then goes away, I call it my kicking in stage. I really encourage those starting this med to stick it out and the side effects will lessen dramatically once you are on it long enough and reach your proper dosage. And do not DRINK on this med, I did once at a friends birthday at the begining and it was uphorea at first then ill and then siezure. If I had not had acholhol I think I would have been siezure free for at least 6 months. Otherwise side effects were managetable on increases of dosages. Looking foward to 1 year of siezure free so I can Drive again. I had a trama related leision and developed Complex Partial Temporal Lobe Epilesy with secondary Grand Mal. Inoperatable I might add as leision is to far into brain, medication is all I have to help and the guiney piggen I endured affected every aspect of my life. This by far has been the most effective and longest lasting. We are (my entire family)watching me closly for the complex partial temporal lobe epilespy, so far it appears now the my other drug Tegretol has been adjusted that I am not experiencing blankness and stiffening as much. We have been marking it on the calender and I month has past including my menstrual cycle - Yeah. Eleven months to go, geting my life back thanks to a great persistent Neurlogist and Lacosimide (Vimpat).

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: HATES  VIMPAT, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: What a HORRIBLE drug for senior citizens!!!  My father, 75 took this to control partial/complex seizures.  Made him dopey, he was walking sideways, falling down and breaking bones, incoherent, just  NO QUALITY OF LIFE ON VIMPAT!!! My Dad took Vimpat for 6 months.  Weaning him off of this horrible stuff.Going on Dilantin to control ALL seizures.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: novimpat4me, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Took VIMPAT for approximately one month.  Adverse reactions of double vision, total lack of balance, irregular heart rate, worsening seizures, were so bad, requested removal of medication.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: roesdad, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: HORRIBLE  DRUG!!  Makes  you  dopey, uncoordinated, like drunk.  Head, room spinning, NOT good for my elderly father, as makes him more likely to fall.  Keeps him awaks all night, and tired next day, once again, more likely to fall.  Does control partial seizures; however, when on this, he has no short term memory, can find words to say something, has no appetite, and way too tired.  If you are elderly, DO NOT TAKE this drug!!  Dilantin will control partial/comples and petit mal seizures as well as convulsive, grand mal seizures!  Going back to Dilantin.

column9: I am on 5 other medications but my neurologist told me that i would probably have to change vimpat after a year and a half to two years. Right now this medication is horrible for me i sweat all day regardless if im in air or not, just sitting around the house, it is horrible. I am really moody and im taking two anti depressants, i get chest pains, my anxiety is getting bad again, i would stay away from this medicine if possible. But everyone is different, it worked okay for me in the beginning after getting my dosage right but now its like its stopping for me. I am staring off all the time and having muscle tremors to where i drop things, my neurologist says im fine but those are types of seizures. i really hope that will help others and there decision on being on vimpat.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: JMartin, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a Temporal Lobe Epileptic diagnosed at 25 yrs old.  Onset was birth.  I am currently on Vimpat 600mg/day and Klonopin 1mg/night to help control noctournal breakthrough.  I also take Buspar, Zoloft, and Xanax for depression and  anxiety.  Vimpat has been very successful in controlling my seizures.  While I have still had the occasional breakthrough, they have been significantly less severe, and have not progressed to complex-partial.  When I first started taking Vimpat, my weight went crazy - Up and down, and I was struggling with focus and irritation.  My Primary Physician added Zoloft 100mg/day at that time and 90% of side effects from the Vimpat vanished.  Depression is a potential side effect of Vimpat, so use care and seek treatment if necessary.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: Jenny, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking Vimpat 1 week ago along with my other medication: Keppra, Celexa, Synthroid, Gabapentin, Camila. The dr started me on just 50 mg, twice a day, and already I am feeling the side effects, a bit of confusion, word retrieval difficulties and depression. I'll be increasing the dosage up to 100 mg, twice a day, next week. Will these side effects go away over time?I also am going to slowly stop taking Gabapentin the week after next. I haven't had a seizure since I started taking Vimpat, but I wasn't having seizures daily. I usually have about 7 a month. I hope this new med stops my seizures, but I just don't like the side effects I am experiencing already. Has anyone had similar difficulties as well that improved? Thanks.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: norton, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I find the drug quite effective by blocking the spread of partial seizures to genralized seizures.  There are some muscle spasms and I find myself stiffening out at times, like a seizure would.  My big concern is the feeling of withdrawl if the next dose is a bit late.  You feel the need like a heroin user would.  I guess this is good as a way of reminding you that it's time for your meds, but still a bit scarey. For the first time in my life, I find myself in need of a nap during the middle of the day, and problems concentrating at times.  This may be increased due to the fact that I take five additional anticonvulsants, but may have found a medication that my seizures respond to.

column9: My Father is 75 years old, and started taking Vimpat, 200mg and Neurontin 1200 mg for convulsive seizures. So far, no side effects for him.  God willing, this will control his seizures.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: Kathy24013, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Vimpat works great for my Complex Partial Seizures. I have a VNS which helped tremenously, but was still having about 6 seizures per month.  Now I am having 1 seizure per month.  It can cause side effects of other medications to come out. I was taking it along with Topamax. It caused side effects of the Topamax to come out, and all but debilitated me. My doctor cut back on the amount of Topamax, and the side effects disappeared. When my doctor increased the Vimpat to 600mg per day I was seeing double, and feeling drunk. He quickly dropped me back to my original dose. Two weeks ago I dropped the Topamax altogether. Have had 1 seizure, but that is what I expect.  Time will tell if increasing my dosage, or adding the Topamax will be needed.I love what Vimpat has done for me!

column2: albella, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm a 10 year brain tumor survivor and take keppra, teg xr, lamictal and now vimpat 3x daily.  I'm concerned with what I've read re suicidal behavior with all these meds (let alone a combo of them).  Since taking vimpat, I've become more easily frustrated, lack energy and have thoughts of taking my life.  I can't attribute this all to the meds I'm on, but more to a decrease in quality of life.  I also suffer from poor balance, muscle weakness, a perceived decrease in cognitive ability, continued seizures and occasional double vision.  I'm a burden on my family and co-workers.  It seems that these feelings have come to the forefront since I've been on Vimpat.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: Tina, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I take 100mg/day of this med in addition to Keppra(2000mg). I started about 4 weeks ago. My dr originally had me to increase up to 200mg/day, but it made me very lightheaded, constipated and fatigue. I decreased back down to 100mg/day and it has actually decreased my partial seizures by 50%.  I also noticed that I'm not as irritable as I was when on Keppra alone. So far I like the interaction.

column1: Other
column2: SEIZURE FREE KIM, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was taking lacosimide in a study with dylantin then by itself.  My seizures started 1/23/09 @38 yrs old.  At age 45, 12/12/08, I had brain surgery and I am still on the lascosimide and have been seizure free since my surgery.  Thank you to my dr. in dallas and to the Lord taking care of me from Heaven above.  Also on 6/12/09 I was granted my driving privileges back.  6 years is a long time depending on everyone for everything.  I am so HAPPY WITH THE LACOSIMIDE.  AND I WILL BE TAKING THE Vimpat when my study is over.  THANK YOU TO MY DRS. AND THE ORIGINAL MAKERS OF LACOSIMIDE BECAUSE IT HELPED ME AND I'M 1 YEAR SEIZURE FREE.  THANK YOU LORD.  SND BLESS EVRYONE WHO READS THIS.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: Kelly, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Vimpat is an add-on to my Lamictal regime.  I see no difference in coverage to Lyrica, but I have found benefits: my long-term memory has improved and I feel more alert. For dizziness, I recommend taking on a full stomach (after a meal)and take 12 hours apart. I haven't decided if I will continue with Vimpat or return to Lyrica. Note to englishbonnet: shame on your husband.  ALWAYS take your medicine on time.  NO EXCUSES for missing a dose.

column1: Other
column2: Boogze2, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was at full strength according to Dr. And had just stopped taken Dilantin after slow process. I missed my medication one night and the following morning and that evening all Hell broke loss. As soon as the Hospital shot me up with extra Dilantin I recovered o.k. The worst was, The hospital had no Vimpat to give me and no Pharmacey ina 50 mile radious had a supply either. Everyone said the same thing. It was to newso no one carried it untill it was proven better. My recomedation is STAY AWAY FROM IT. ITS NOT PROVEN YET. IT ALSO HAD BAD SIDE EFFECTS. MAINLY DEPRESSION AND ADDITION TO IT. I WAS LUCKY I GUESS, AFTERMY 3RD GRAND MALL THAT NIGHT I RECOVERED WHEN I WAS PUMPED WITH DILANTIN. SO I NEVER TOUCHED VIMPAT AGAIN.  I've only had one Petite seizure in  thelast four months thanks to a Christian man that was their and did hands on prayer.  Jesus is  the True Healer.

column1: Other
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: A few months ago I was prescribed Vimpat for neuropathic pain in my feet/legs due to a severe ms exacerbation (I could not take Lyrica or Neurontin because it can cause swelling of the feet). I started taking 50 mg, then 100 mg and finally up to 150 mg. of Vimpat. However, after just a couple of weeks of taking Vimpat, my body started to shake often throughout the day and sometimes had very strong tremors. Also had serious memory problems. I have always been a person who finishes other people's sentences but when I was taking Vimpat, other people were finishing my sentences for me (very frustrating). A new mri of my brain proved there were no new lesions so my doctor suspected that Vimpat was the likely problem. After I stopped taking Vimpat, my body stopped shaking, the tremors stopped and my memory is back to normal. I took Vimpat for a total of three months and it never really addressed the pain. NOTE: if you do take Vimpat or need to get it, you can go to www.vimpat.com and click on "Get your Savings Card" on the bottom of the home page where it says "Vimpat Savings Program". After you sign up, you can print a coupon that gives you $30.00 off each Vimpat prescription/refill for up to a year. I have very good insurance but it still cost me $80.00/month without the coupon. These days every little bit helps!

column1: Other
column2: deborah, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a major back surgery, 2 years ago.  I take vimpat for nerve pain. Im very pleased with the results. I have leg and back pain.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: englishbonnet, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My husband is taking this medication with Lamictal to control temporal lobe seizures that affect both sides of the brain. He has been on it since a July video EEG at the hospital. I thought it was helping. His seizures come approx every two weeks for one night and usually he only has about three. It seems that accidentally forgetting just one dose of both medications induced five seizures approx an hour apart and then one when he was at work. He's forgotten a combination of previous medications before and never had this reaction to it. I think the Vimpat might have increased the number of seizures he had when he missed his dose. It has caused severe depression and huge mood swings, paranoia and a feeling of poor self-worth, dizziness, and a general loss of memory. We are not that happy about this. We will be seeking advice and a possible change in medications again.
